questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

You have a Teams Phone deployment that uses Direct Routing.

You have two users named User1 and User2.

You need to move the assigned licenses and phone number of User1 to User2.

Which four actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

//IMG//

You have a Teams Phone deployment that contains two sites named Site1 and Site2. Each site has a Session Border Controller (SBC).

You have a user named User1.

User1 relocates from Site1 to Site2 and is assigned a new phone number.

You need to change a policy assigned to User1 to ensure that the SBC at Site2 is used when the user makes outbound calls.

What should you change?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
correct - direct routing

Here's another Learn doc that indicates this is the correct answer:
 Plan and configure dynamic emergency calling:
 https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/configure-dynamic-emergency-calling
 "Trusted IP addresses contain a collection of the internet external IP addresses of the enterprise network and are used to determine if the user's endpoint is inside the corporate network. An attempt to obtain a dynamic policy or location based on the endpoints IP address will only be made if the user's external IP address matches an IP address in the trusted IP addresses."
Repeat question from the old MS-720 exam. The answer is correct - https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/manage-your-network-topology#manage-external-trusted-ip-addresses

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment that uses Direct Routing. The deployment has the following configurations:

• Direct Routing Session Border Controller (SBC) public IP subnet: 198.51.100.0/24
• Teams client external IP subnet: 203.0.113.0/24
• Teams client internal IP subnet: 192.168.0.0/24

You need to configure the network topology to support emergency call routing.

Which network range should you add to the trusted IP addresses?

discussion.content: Emergency calling is correct. Emergency call routing is where you can translate 911 or 9911, etc.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.

You need to ensure that when a user dials an emergency number, the security desk receives a notification to join the call.

Which type of policy should you configure?

comments.content: I think that the first command should be: Set-CsTenantNetworkSite -Identity "Mumbai" -EnableLocationBasedRouting $true

discussion.content:
The answers seem correct but the commands should be New-CsOnlinePSTNGateway and Set-CsOnlinePSTNGateway.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/teams/new-csonlinepstngateway?view=teams-ps#-fqdn
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/teams/set-csonlinepstngateway?view=teams-ps&viewFallbackFrom=skype-ps#-gatewaysitelbrenabled

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Teams Phone deployment that contains an office in Mumbai.

The Mumbai office has a new Session Border Controller (SBC) named SBC1 that uses Direct Routing.

Users must be able to use SBC1 only when they are at the Mumbai office.

How should you complete the commands? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//
